Content.Title: Council
Content.Abstract: The SRC Council is made up of volunteers who work in several different areas from participating in administrative councils to designing surveys to researching and drafting policy proposals.
Content.BodyCopy:
Council members are chosen through an application and interview process. They commit to serve for an entire semester and to fulfill assigned office hours according to their position description. Council members work under the direction of the Student Body Officers and meet weekly with other Student Support councils including the Get Connected, Student Ambassadors, Involvement, and Student Associations councils.

Apply: The application period for the Spring 2012 semester is closed. Applications for Fall Semester 2012 will open in late June.

Council Representative

Time Commitment: 4 hours/week

A Council Representative acts as a full-fledged member of one or two of the university's administrative councils representing the student body by providing student input on the council's initiatives and by presenting the SRC's proposals to administrators.

Council topics may include academic standards and policies, enrollment and financial services, curriculum and the Learning Model, online learning, computer technology and the web, campus planning and development, parking and more.

Important: This position requires strong interpersonal communications skills and a strong commitment to consistently attend administrative council meetings throughout the semester and develop one-on-one relationships with the administrators that participate in those councils. Students with a strong leadership background are especially encouraged to apply for this position.

Student Voice Manager

Time Commitment: 4 hours/week

Student Voice managers lead sessions of 20-30 volunteers in sorting, summarizing, and discussing the results of the Student Voice surveys. They also assist the Student Voice Coordinators in writing the Student Voice Surveys.

Research Analyst

Time Commitment: 4 hours/week

Research analysts research student issues and solutions and then prepare proposals and reports to be presented in administrative councils.

Councils Coordinator

Time Commitment: 6-8 hours/week

Two Council Coordinators train, supervise, and coordinate SRC volunteers that sit on administrative councils. They also coordinate the presentation of proposals and survey results in councils.

Student Voice Coordinator

Time Commitment: 6-8 hours/week

Two Student Voice Coordinators supervise the writing of the Student Voice surveys. They also train and coordinate a group of 2-3 Student Voice Managers that will each lead a group of 15-20 volunteers in analyzing, discussing, and summarizing the results of the Student Voice surveys.

Research Coordinator

Time Commitment: 6-8 hours/week

Two Research Coordinators lead the research efforts of the the SRC. Together with 4 research analysts, they work with the Councils area in preparing proposals and reports to be presented in administrative councils. The research coordinators also work directly with administrators to produce public "University Responses" to the most common student issues and questions.
